title: Dynamics 365 CE / Power Platform Architect
description:
Dynamics 365 CE / Power Platform Technical Architect - NYC - $180k - Remote Flex

Your New Company: Our client is in the industrial products space selling services for the commercial, industrial, healthcare/life sciences and residential building markets. They have been expanding rapidly over the past year, consistently acquiring new companies every quarter, and are now looking for a senior-level Dynamics 365 CE Architect to join their team.

Your New Role: Technical Architect
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced techno-functional resource specializing in Microsoft Power Platform, with deep expertise in Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE). This role requires hands-on development experience with C# plugin workflows, architectural design of CE solutions, and comprehensive knowledge of environment and instance management within the Microsoft ecosystem.
location: New York City, New York, United States

title: Data Analyst - SQL & Python
description: Are you ready to make a real impact as the first Data Analyst in a well-established organisation? We're recruiting on behalf of a respected business who are on a journey to become truly data-driven. This is a unique opportunity to shape their data strategy from the ground up, reporting directly to the Data Lead. Whilst they're based in Corby (Northamptonshire), this role is open to candidates across the UK who are happy to travel into the office once every two weeks. What you'll be doing: Manipulating and analysing large, complex datasets using SQL and Python. Driving data-informed decision-making across the business. Leading initiatives around data quality, management, and governance. Supporting the introduction of Snowflake into the data environment. Exploring future opportunities to apply AI for automation and efficiency. What we're looking for: Strong experience with SQL and Python for data manipulation and analysis. An understanding of data governance and data quality. A proactive mindset and ability to work independently. Knowledge of Snowflake (desirable but not essential). Passion for improving data processes and driving innovation. What you'll be rewarded with: Salary up to £40-45,000 depending on experience. 21 days holiday + 4.5 days to be taken over Christmas + bank holidays + option to buy more days off. Flexible working hours. Company pension scheme. If you're looking for a role where you can shape strategy, drive innovation, and grow with the business - this could be the perfect fit. Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a DBS and Credit Check.

title: D365FO Support Analyst - Hybrid - GBP60k
description: We are working with a leading manufacturer currently implementing D365FO and they are now seeking a Support Analyst to support this major digital transformation. The successful candidate will play a key role in supporting and enhancing their hybrid ERP estate (AX 2012 / D365FO / BI) and related production systems across the business. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a well-established, growth-focused organisation at a pivotal moment as they move toward full D365FO deployment. You will support the 2nd-3rd line application support function, collaborate with business stakeholders, and deliver projects that improve operational efficiency and system performance.

title: Dynamics 365 Platform Senior Consultant
description: Are you interested in working in a dynamic environment that offers opportunities for professional growth and new responsibilities? If so, Deloitte & Touche LLP could be the place for you. Traditional security programs have often been unsuccessful in unifying the need to both secure and support technology innovation required by the business. Join Deloitte's Advisory Cyber Risk Services team and become a member of the largest group of Cyber Risk individuals worldwide. As a Senior Consultant, you will be in the front lines with our clients supporting them with their Cyber Risk needs specifically helping them address Dynamics 365 Platform. You will solve evolving business challenges by analyzing and implementing Cyber services on D365 services involving D365 Finance, D365 Project Operations, D365 Supply Chain Management, D365 Sales, Customer Service, Field Service, Marketing, Business Central etc. to the top global organizations. You will implement D365 security solutions leveraging subject matter knowledge and experience across cyber security domains such as governance & strategy, data privacy & protection, identity & access management, infrastructure security, encryption, logging and monitoring etc. in alignment with shared security responsibilities. You will configure, customize, and support Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications (such as Sales, Customer Service, Field Service, or Finance & Operations) to meet business requirements, analyze business processes and translate them into Dynamics 365 solutions, and serve as a subject matter specialist in multiple domains of Dynamics 365 platform, MS 365, and Power Platform.

title: D365 CRM / Power Platform Solutions Architect
description:
Are you a strategic thinker with deep hands-on expertise in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform? We're seeking a Solutions Architect to lead the design, implementation, and optimization of our CRM and automation ecosystem as we scale rapidly. This is more than a technical role - it's a chance to shape the digital backbone of a fast-growing, entrepreneurial company.

What You'll Be Doing:
- Architect and optimize end-to-end solutions across D365 Customer Service, Sales, and Marketing, leveraging PowerApps, Power Automate, and related tools.
- Own the technical roadmap for CRM and automation, ensuring alignment with business goals.
- Collaborate with and manage deliverables from our Managed Service Provider (MSP) to ensure quality, security, and performance.
- Use your knowledge of SQL and APIs to drive integrations, data flow, and reporting across platforms.
- Lead project scoping, technical design, and execution in partnership with internal teams and external vendors.
- Serve as a strategic advisor to executive leadership, with a direct path toward technology leadership roles like CTO.

Why Join Us:
- EOS-Driven Culture: We run on the Entrepreneurial Operating System, which means clarity, accountability, and a fast-moving, no-red-tape environment.
- High-Growth Opportunity: We're on track to double in size - be part of a team growing from 30 to 60 corporate employees (and 150+ property staff).
- Leadership Track: This isn't a back-office role - you'll have major influence on our tech strategy and a clear path to becoming CTO.

Let's Build the Future Together. If you're ready to architect systems that drive scale, efficiency, and innovation - we want to hear from you.

title: Power Platforms Engineer
description: Apex Systems is seeking an experienced Power Platforms Engineer for a large financial client. The position is a 12-18 mo. Contract position that requires candidates to sit onsite in Charlotte, NC or Addison, TX on a hybrid schedule (3x per week onsite). We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative Power Platforms Engineer to join our team. You will be part of a team responsible for enabling Power Apps and Power Automate services for the enterprise. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience administering Power Platforms, developing applications using Power Apps and building workflows using Power Automate. This role requires a deep understanding of Power Platform concepts such as tenant settings and configuration, environment provisioning and management, data loss policies, licensing, monitoring. In addition, a solid understanding of business processes, systems engineering, and the ability to translate requirements into efficient and scalable designs.

title: Senior Power Platform Developer
description:
Senior Power Platform Developer

Job Location: Bangalore

- 6+ years of hands-on experience in developing applications using Power Apps (Canvas and Model-Driven) and Power Automate.
- Strong knowledge of SharePoint, SQL, and REST APIs.
- Experience with Power BI for reporting and dashboards (preferred).

title: Systems Administrator
description: The customer is in search of a Systems Administrator to play a key role in assisting the OIT in the oversight, management, troubleshooting, and execution of cloud services and platforms to support infrastructure, applications, data, and other business needs. The duties of this position can be broad and may include such tasks as adding and removing individuals from the list of authorized users, archiving files, overseeing password protection and other security measures, and monitoring usage of shared resources. Architect, design, facilitate, lead, coordinate, and direct technology initiatives on multiple fronts across a variety of disparate areas within the organization. This could include Infrastructure administration, application development, data management & analytics, cybersecurity, external hosting, identity and access management, infrastructure, network, security hardening, privacy, and compliance. Oversight and management of Microsoft 365 environments and other Microsoft platforms, identity platforms, and a multi-cloud environment. Selects, develops, integrates and implements network management applications for Internet components. The Systems Administrator will be responsible for working on projects, systems, and/or issues of medium to high complexity and will be expected to provide daily operations support, maintenance, and administration for Servers. This position requires ownership of complex issues in order to support Department business.
skills: ['Server 2012 R2', 'Server 2016', 'Server 2019', 'Server 2022', 'IIS Administration', 'TCP/IP', 'DNS', 'Samba/CIFS', 'NTFS permissions', 'Microsoft Azure', 'AWS', 'GCP', 'Microsoft software administration', 'API Management', 'IT Service Automation tools', 'Batch job services', 'Microsoft 365', 'Microsoft Power Platform', 'Azure DevOps', 'Networking principles', 'Cloud-based network architectures']
responsibilities: ['Support and expand infrastructure.', 'Coordinate server configuration and administration with multiple parties (SDC, and contractors).', 'Make recommendations for future server and software upgrades.', 'Monitor systems and applications to ensure security, availability, and performance.', 'Establish systems by evaluating network performance issues including availability, utilization, throughput, goodput, and latency; planning and executing the selection, installation, configuration, and testing of equipment; defining network policies and procedures; establishing connections and firewalls.', 'Maintain network and systems performance by performing systems monitoring and analysis, and performance tuning; troubleshooting systems and application problems; escalating problems to vendor.', 'Build and manage relationships in a matrixed environment.', 'Find opportunities to refactor solutions to obtain better performance, cost, and efficiency.', 'Create and manage Azure DevOps projects, git repositories, and pipelines.', 'Oversee and configure Azure DevOps organizational settings.', 'Recommend and assist with the building and hosting of complex application solutions.', 'Understand, deploy, and manage Microsoft Azure and/or other cloud services.', 'Understand, deploy, and manage Microsoft Power Platform.', 'Understand and manage Microsoft 365 services.', 'Support other IT staff, including developers.', 'Other duties as assigned.']
qualifications: ["Bachelor's Degree or technical institute degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field, or equivalent work experience.", '2 - 3 years experience with Server 2012 R2, 2016, 2019, and 2022.', '2 - 3 years IIS Administration.', '2 - 3 years of network communications, including TCP/IP and DNS, Samba/CIFS file sharing and NTFS permissions.', '2 - 3 years of strong professional experience in Microsoft Azure cloud systems is highly desired.', '2 - 3 years of experience with other cloud providers, such as AWS or GCP is highly desired.', '2 - 3 years of professional experience in the administration of Microsoft software is highly desired.', '3 - 5 years of IT work experience in infrastructure/network environments in systems operations, support, maintenance, and administration.', '3 - 5 years of professional experience supporting middleware such as API Management, IT Service Automation tools, and batch job services is highly desired.', '5 - 8 years of professional experience in information systems engineering or another related field is required.']

title: Dynamics 365 CE Consultant
description: My client is a leading provider of innovative technology solutions, specialising in Microsoft Dynamics 365 implementations. We are committed to delivering exceptional services to our clients, helping them transform their businesses and achieve their goals. We are seeking a highly skilled Dynamics 365 CE Consultant to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Malmo and Gothenburg. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE) and possess a deep understanding of CRM processes and best practices. This is an exciting opportunity to work on greenfield projects and make a significant impact on our clients' success.

title: D365 Business Central Consultant (SCM focus)
description:
D365 Business Central - SCM Consultant
Location: Malmö / Hybrid
Employer: Leading Microsoft Partner
Are you an experienced Dynamics 365 Business Central (D365 BC) professional with a passion for Supply Chain Management (SCM)? Would you like to join a forward-thinking Microsoft Partner that values innovation, flexibility, and collaboration?
We're supporting a top-tier Microsoft Dynamics Partner in Malmö that is expanding its consulting team. They're now looking to bring on board an experienced D365 Business Central Consultant with a strong background in Supply Chain processes to support their growing pipeline of local and international projects.
Your Role:
As a key part of the consulting team, you will:
- Lead and deliver full life cycle D365 Business Central implementations, with a focus on SCM (purchasing, inventory, warehousing, logistics).
- Collaborate with project managers, developers, and fellow consultants in a dynamic partner environment.
- Work closely with end clients to understand business needs, gather requirements, and translate them into scalable BC solutions.
- Take ownership of the supply chain workstreams, ensuring successful delivery from design to go-live.
- Contribute to both new implementations and upgrades from NAV to D365 BC.
What We're Looking For:
- 3+ years' experience with Dynamics NAV / D365 Business Central, ideally across multiple versions (NAV 2009 through to BC SaaS).
- Proven track record in Supply Chain Management modules (e.g., procurement, inventory, order management, warehouse).
- Solid functional consulting skills - comfortable running workshops, gathering requirements, configuring systems, and training users.
- Experience in a Microsoft Partner or customer-facing consulting environment is highly desirable.
- Strong communication skills in English - Swedish is a plus.
Why Apply?
- Be part of a highly respected Microsoft Gold Partner with a growing footprint in Sweden.
- Work on exciting SCM transformation projects with established clients.
- Enjoy a hybrid working model, flexible hours, and a supportive team culture.
- Competitive compensation, great benefits, and strong career development opportunities.

title: D365 F&O Finance Functional Consultant
description:
We\'re Hiring: D365 F&O Finance Functional Consultant
Location: Irving, TX (Hybrid)
Industry: End-User - Construction/Project-based Environment
Are you a seasoned D365 Finance & Operations Functional Consultant with a passion for streamlining finance operations and delivering impactful solutions? Join a forward-thinking end-user company in Irving, TX, and be a part of a dynamic digital transformation journey!
What You\'ll Do:
- Act as the subject matter expert for Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations, focusing on core finance modules (GL, AP, AR, FA, Budgeting, etc.)
- Lead and support Finance-related configurations, testing, and deployment activities
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth integration with PMA/Project Operations
- Partner with internal stakeholders to translate business requirements into functional designs
- Provide user training, support, and continuous improvement recommendations
Requirements:
- Proven experience with D365 F&O (required)
- Expertise in core Finance modules within D365
- Hands-on experience with Project Management & Accounting (PMA) or Project Operations
- Familiarity with Avalara Tax and ExFlow (preferred)
- Strong understanding of financial processes and best practices
- Consulting and Project Management experience (preferred)
- Background in the construction industry or project-based environments is a strong plus
Why Join Us?
- Be part of a fast-growing, tech-forward company
- Enjoy a collaborative team culture with strong executive support
- Work on innovative projects that directly impact the business
- Competitive compensation & benefits package
Ready to make an impact? Apply now and help shape the future of finance operations with D365 F&O!

title: Data Engineer
description: Join a rapidly growing Microsoft Partner Consultancy as a Data Engineer or Senior Data Engineer! This is your chance to join a rapidly growing Microsoft Partner who've developed a cutting-edge Microsoft Data Platform, helping their customers accelerate their data journeys. From better data management to smarter insights, you'll play a key role in enabling businesses to make truly data-driven decisions. Remote-first with flexibility: Work from anywhere in the UK, or from one of their regional offices if you prefer. Plus, enjoy bi-monthly company-wide events to connect, celebrate success, and collaborate with your team. What you'll do: You'll work end-to-end on enterprise-level data solutions—from data and systems integration, migrations (including CRM and ERP), and building robust data pipelines, to analytics and visualisation. Senior Engineers will also lead teams and drive best practices. Tech stack you'll work with: Python | SQL | Azure Data Factory | Azure Synapse | Azure Data Lake | Dynamics 365 | Power BI | Microsoft Fabric.

title: Modern Workplace - Specialist Master
description:
Modern Workplace Manager/Specialist Master-AI & Engineering
Join our AI & Engineering team by transforming technology platforms, driving innovation, and helping make a significant impact on our clients' success. You’ll collaborate with talented professionals, reimagining and re-engineering operations and processes that are critical to business. Your contributions can help clients improve financial performance, accelerate new digital ventures, and fuel growth through innovation. AI & Engineering leverages innovative engineering capabilities to build, deploy, and operate integrated/verticalized sector solutions in software, data, AI, network, and hybrid cloud infrastructure. These solutions are powered by engineering for business advantage, transforming mission-critical operations. We enable clients to stay ahead with the latest advancements by transforming engineering teams and modernizing technology & data platforms. Our delivery models are tailored to meet each client's unique requirements.

Work you’ll do
Our AI & Data practice offers comprehensive solutions for designing, developing, and operating advanced Data and AI platforms, products, insights, and services. We help clients innovate, enhance, and manage their data, AI, and analytics capabilities, ensuring they can grow and scale effectively. The Modern Workplace Consultant strives to build an end user experience that enables users to work independently and efficiently adopting cutting edge technologies. Our Modern Workplace team guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of workplace services. We help our clients optimize their workplace experience through collaborative tools that increase productivity and allow seamless communication and collaborations amongst teams. These include transformations for BYOD, mobility, desktop delivery, collaboration, end user experience management, user support environments, Microsoft 365 Copilot implementations, Power Platform development, and virtual desktop infrastructure.

title: D365 Business Central Consultant (SCM focus)
description:
D365 Business Central - SCM Consultant
Location: Malmö / Hybrid
Employer: Leading Microsoft Partner
Are you an experienced Dynamics 365 Business Central (D365 BC) professional with a passion for Supply Chain Management (SCM)? Would you like to join a forward-thinking Microsoft Partner that values innovation, flexibility, and collaboration?
We're supporting a top-tier Microsoft Dynamics Partner in Malmö that is expanding its consulting team. They're now looking to bring on board an experienced D365 Business Central Consultant with a strong background in Supply Chain processes to support their growing pipeline of local and international projects.
Your Role:
As a key part of the consulting team, you will:
- Lead and deliver full life cycle D365 Business Central implementations, with a focus on SCM (purchasing, inventory, warehousing, logistics).
- Collaborate with project managers, developers, and fellow consultants in a dynamic partner environment.
- Work closely with end clients to understand business needs, gather requirements, and translate them into scalable BC solutions.
- Take ownership of the supply chain workstreams, ensuring successful delivery from design to go-live.
- Contribute to both new implementations and upgrades from NAV to D365 BC.
What We're Looking For:
- 3+ years' experience with Dynamics NAV / D365 Business Central, ideally across multiple versions (NAV 2009 through to BC SaaS).
- Proven track record in Supply Chain Management modules (e.g., procurement, inventory, order management, warehouse).
- Solid functional consulting skills - comfortable running workshops, gathering requirements, configuring systems, and training users.
- Experience in a Microsoft Partner or customer-facing consulting environment is highly desirable.
- Strong communication skills in English - Swedish is a plus.
Why Apply?
- Be part of a highly respected Microsoft Gold Partner with a growing footprint in Sweden.
- Work on exciting SCM transformation projects with established clients.
- Enjoy a hybrid working model, flexible hours, and a supportive team culture.
- Competitive compensation, great benefits, and strong career development opportunities.

title: Dynamics 365 CE Developer
description:
Job Title: Dynamics CE/CRM Developer
Location: Gothenburg
Company: Leading Microsoft Gold Partner
Are you a skilled Dynamics CRM Developer ready to deliver innovative CRM solutions that make an impact? Join a renowned Microsoft Gold Partner where you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, collaborate with top professionals, and contribute to transformative projects for high-profile clients.
Your Role:
As a Dynamics CRM Developer, you will:
- Develop and customize Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions to meet client needs.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions.
- Extend CRM functionality through custom code, plugins, workflows, and third-party integrations.
- Conduct unit testing, debugging, and code reviews to ensure quality and performance.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest Dynamics CRM features and provide innovative solutions.
- Create and maintain technical documentation, including design documents and user manuals.
What You'll Need:
- Fluency in Swedish (written and verbal) is essential.
- Proven experience developing and customizing Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions using .NET, C#, JavaScript, and SQL.
- Strong understanding of CRM architecture, including entity relationships, workflows, forms, and security models.
- Hands-on experience with tools like Visual Studio, XRM Toolbox, and the CRM SDK.
- Familiarity with web technologies (HTML, CSS, REST/SOAP web services) and integration tools.
- Knowledge of data migration and CRM integration techniques.
- A degree in Computer Science or a related field (equivalent experience considered).
- Microsoft Dynamics CRM certifications (e.g., MB-210, MB-220, MB-230) are a plus.
- Excellent problem-solving, collaboration, and communication skills.
What's in It for You?
Join a team that values innovation, growth, and work-life balance:
- Competitive Salary: Attractive package with performance-based incentives.
- Health & Wellness: Comprehensive health insurance and wellness programs.
- Flexibility: Hybrid working model with flexible hours.
- Growth Opportunities: Ongoing training, certifications, and professional development.
- Team Culture: Collaborative environment with supportive colleagues and leaders.
- Exciting Projects: Work on prestigious client engagements using the latest technologies.
- Perks: Generous vacation, paid time off, social events, and employee recognition programs.
Why Join Us?
As a Microsoft Gold Partner, we're committed to excellence, innovation, and empowering our employees. You'll have the chance to advance your career while delivering impactful solutions that drive success for our clients.
If you're ready to take the next step in your career as a Dynamics CRM Developer, apply now and become part of a team where your skills and creativity make a difference!

title: Dynamics 365 CE Developer
description:
Job Title: Dynamics 365 CE/.NET Developer
Locations: Stockholm or Gothenburg
Company: Leading Microsoft Solutions Partner
Drive Digital Transformation with a Microsoft Powerhouse
Are you passionate about building CRM solutions that deliver real business value? Join one of Sweden's premier Microsoft Solutions Partners, where innovation meets impact. We're looking for a Dynamics 365 CE Developer who enjoys solving complex challenges, and wants to be part of transformative CRM projects across both private and public sector clients.
Your Role
As a Dynamics 365 CE Developer, you will play a key role in designing and developing modern CRM solutions that drive customer success. You'll work in agile teams alongside solution architects, consultants, and technical specialists to deliver high-quality business applications based on Microsoft's Power Platform.
Your key responsibilities include:
- Developing, extending, and customizing Dynamics 365 CE solutions using best-in-class tools and technologies.
- Designing and building plugins, custom workflows, business rules, and integrations to meet client requirements.
- Working closely with stakeholders to gather functional needs and translate them into technical designs.
- Collaborating with UI/UX teams to enhance customer journeys and user interfaces.
- Participating in code reviews, testing, troubleshooting, and optimizing performance.
- Keeping up with the latest Microsoft technologies and contributing to internal knowledge sharing.
- Documenting solutions and providing technical guidance to end users and junior developers
What We're Looking For
We're searching for an experienced and motivated developer who enjoys working in fast-paced environments and is committed to excellence.
Essentials:
- Solid experience developing and customizing Dynamics 365 CE (CRM) solutions.
- Strong proficiency in .NET, C#, JavaScript, and SQL.
- Deep understanding of Dynamics CE architecture: entities, workflows, security models, forms, and business rules.
- Experience with integration tools, APIs (REST/SOAP), and data migration strategies.
- Working knowledge of Power Platform, Power Automate, and custom connectors is a plus.
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
- Microsoft certifications (e.g., MB-210, MB-230, PL-200, PL-400) are highly desirable.
What You'll Get in Return
You'll join a highly respected Microsoft partner with a culture built on knowledge-sharing, trust, and continuous improvement.
- Competitive Salary: Transparent pay model with potential for bonuses.
- Career Development: Funded training, certifications, and dedicated mentorship programs.
- Flexible Work Style: Hybrid setup with a healthy work-life balance.
- Modern Tech Stack: Work with the latest Microsoft cloud services and enterprise clients.
- Employee Wellbeing: Comprehensive health insurance, wellness allowance, and generous paid leave.
- Vibrant Culture: Team events, innovation days, and a strong emphasis on collaboration and inclusion.
Why Join Us?
As a trusted Microsoft Solutions Partner, we deliver critical CRM and cloud solutions to clients across defense, telecommunications, government, and enterprise sectors. You'll be empowered to build future-proof systems that have a real-world impact - all while advancing your career in a supportive, growth-focused environment. If you're ready to take the next step in your career as a Dynamics CRM Developer, apply now and become part of a team where your skills and creativity make a difference!

title: (Senior) Business Analyst - BI / Data
description: My client, a global sourcing and supply chain management company with HQ in Europe but business network across the globe, is now urgently looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join the regional team. Key Responsibilities: Design and develop dashboards and reports to support business operations and decision-making. Perform ad-hoc data analysis by converting raw, unstructured data into actionable insights. Collect, organize, and transform data from multiple sources into meaningful business information. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective data visualizations. Analyze and understand business processes and source systems to connect data for in-depth analysis. Create comprehensive documentation, presentations, and training materials for end-users. Manage the generation and delivery of routine reports and scheduled data jobs. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field. At least 4 years of experience in roles such as Business Analyst, Data Analyst, System Analyst, or System Support. Proven experience in system design, implementation, and stakeholder engagement. Strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and problem-solving abilities. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly. Strong business acumen and practical judgement. Proficiency in statistical data analysis and the ability to communicate insights and recommendations effectively. Skilled in data storytelling and visualization, using tools such as PowerPoint and BI platforms. Creative in designing and building data dashboards and visualization interfaces. Hands-on experience with SQL, PL/SQL, Python, VBA, BI tools, RPA, SharePoint, O365 applications, database design, and metadata management. In-depth understanding of business processes and the interrelated nature of data systems. More experienced candidate can be considered as Senior Business Analyst. This is an exceptional opportunity to join a high-impact project within hybrid and flexible working environment, supported by a comprehensive remuneration package and staff benefits. We are aiming to fill this role asap - if you believe this position aligns with your background and ambitions, please send your CV to s.liao@nigelfrank.com or call +852 3018 0382 for a confidential discussion.

title: Dynamics 365 CE Developer
description:
Job Title: Dynamics CE/CRM Developer
Location: Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg, Sweden
Company: Leading Microsoft Gold Partner
Are you a skilled Dynamics CRM Developer ready to deliver innovative CRM solutions that make an impact? Join a renowned Microsoft Gold Partner where you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, collaborate with top professionals, and contribute to transformative projects for high-profile clients.
Your Role:
As a Dynamics CRM Developer, you will:
- Develop and customize Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions to meet client needs.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions.
- Extend CRM functionality through custom code, plugins, workflows, and third-party integrations.
- Conduct unit testing, debugging, and code reviews to ensure quality and performance.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest Dynamics CRM features and provide innovative solutions.
- Create and maintain technical documentation, including design documents and user manuals.
What You'll Need:
- Fluency in Swedish (written and verbal) is essential.
- Proven experience developing and customizing Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions using .NET, C#, JavaScript, and SQL.
- Strong understanding of CRM architecture, including entity relationships, workflows, forms, and security models.
- Hands-on experience with tools like Visual Studio, XRM Toolbox, and the CRM SDK.
- Familiarity with web technologies (HTML, CSS, REST/SOAP web services) and integration tools.
- Knowledge of data migration and CRM integration techniques.
- A degree in Computer Science or a related field (equivalent experience considered).
- Microsoft Dynamics CRM certifications (e.g., MB-210, MB-220, MB-230) are a plus.
- Excellent problem-solving, collaboration, and communication skills.
What's in It for You?
Join a team that values innovation, growth, and work-life balance:
- Competitive Salary: Attractive package with performance-based incentives.
- Health & Wellness: Comprehensive health insurance and wellness programs.
- Flexibility: Hybrid working model with flexible hours.
- Growth Opportunities: Ongoing training, certifications, and professional development.
- Team Culture: Collaborative environment with supportive colleagues and leaders.
- Exciting Projects: Work on prestigious client engagements using the latest technologies.
- Perks: Generous vacation, paid time off, social events, and employee recognition programs.
Why Join Us?
As a Microsoft Gold Partner, we're committed to excellence, innovation, and empowering our employees. You'll have the chance to advance your career while delivering impactful solutions that drive success for our clients.
If you're ready to take the next step in your career as a Dynamics CRM Developer, apply now and become part of a team where your skills and creativity make a difference!

title: Power BI Specialist/Consultant
description: This is an opportunity to join a growing business in the Engineering and Manufacturing space and take ownership of the full Power BI lifecycle. In this role you will connect to sources, shape data with Power Query/M, build star-schema models, write advanced DAX, design visuals, and publish to the Service. Candidates must be able to demonstrate strong experience in such roles prior to this one. Candidates will also be expected to demonstrate experience with: Building and maintaining enterprise-grade ETL pipelines with SSIS, Azure Data Factory, or similar to feed a data warehouse / data lake. Designing scalable tabular / SSAS models and implementing row-level security on large datasets. Optimizing report and query performance on high-volume platforms such as Snowflake or SQL Server. Administering workspaces, gateways, scheduled refresh, and usage monitoring in Power BI Service. Extending solutions with the wider Microsoft stack (Power Apps, Power Automate, Azure Data Lake) for end-to-end analytics workflows.

title: Junior Power BI Consultant - Home-based
description: A well-established software consultancy is expanding its Business Intelligence offering and is looking for a Junior Power BI Consultant to join the team. This is an exciting opportunity for a Power BI enthusiast who's eager to grow into a fully-fledged, customer-facing Consultant role. You'll be home-based, with some travel to Solihull - initially this will be as much as 2-4 times per month, likely reducing over time. As such, this role is open to candidates across a large area of the UK. Why Join? Historically focused on delivering software solutions, the company is now integrating Power BI to help clients unlock deeper insights and make smarter business decisions. You'll play a key role in this transformation - starting internally and progressing into a client-facing role with full training and support. What You'll Be Doing: Initially, you'll join the Support team as the internal Power BI specialist, sharing your knowledge and building your expertise. Over time, you'll transition into a Consultant role, working alongside sales, pre-sales, and consulting teams to deliver impactful BI solutions. Your responsibilities will include: Collaborating with internal teams to scope and deliver Power BI solutions. Leading discovery sessions and supporting pre-sales activities, including demos and presentations. Designing, developing, and implementing bespoke Power BI dashboards and reports. Providing training and support to end users. You'll be supported every step of the way, with a clear path to becoming a fully-fledged Consultant within approximately 18 months. At that point, you can expect a significant uplift in your package - including a higher base salary, car allowance, and performance bonus.

Are you a Business Systems Analyst with a passion for making a difference?
We're working with a well-established end user based in Manchester that's investing heavily in digital transformation. They're looking to bring on board a Business Systems Analyst to help shape and deliver innovative solutions across their Microsoft ecosystem.

The Role
As a key member of the internal IT and transformation team, you'll be responsible for:

- Career development opportunities and support for Microsoft certifications.
- Competitive salary and benefits package.

Bachelor's degree preferred (or equivalent experience) | D365 certifications a plus
Apply now or reach out to learn more!

title: SharePoint Online Engineer and Administrator
description: Everyone is trying to “harness the power of the Cloud,” but not everyone knows how. As a Power Platform engineer, you know how to level Microsoft's line of business intelligence toolsets to take advantage of Cloud capabilities while meeting client expectations. What if you could use your Power Platform skills to improve warfighter communication? We need you to help us develop Cloud-based solutions to some of our client's toughest challenges. As a Cloud engineer on our team, you’ll support the transition and sustainment of services to the Cloud. You’ll recommend tools and capabilities based on your research of the current environment and knowledge of various on-premises, Cloud-based, and hybrid resources. You’ll lead your team as they help the customer overcome their most difficult challenges in the Cloud. Your technical expertise will be vital as you work with our client and various Cyber organizations to ensure standards are met throughout the Cloud migration process. This is an opportunity to use the latest Cloud technologies as you look for ways to improve your customer’s environment using current Cloud capabilities. You’ll be able to sharpen your skills in Cloud-based security and Azure technology while developing critical systems for the DoD. As a technical leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to build Cloud-based solutions to help your customers meet their evolving needs. Join our team as we transform, strengthen, and capitalize on warfighter communication with Cloud technology. Join us. The world can't wait.

title: SharePoint Online Engineer and Administrator
description: Everyone is trying to “harness the power of the Cloud,” but not everyone knows how. As a Power Platform engineer, you know how to level Microsoft's line of business intelligence toolsets to take advantage of Cloud capabilities while meeting client expectations. What if you could use your Power Platform skills to improve warfighter communication? We need you to help us develop Cloud-based solutions to some of our client's toughest challenges. As a Cloud engineer on our team, you’ll support the transition and sustainment of services to the Cloud. You’ll recommend tools and capabilities based on your research of the current environment and knowledge of various on-premises, Cloud-based, and hybrid resources. You’ll lead your team as they help the customer overcome their most difficult challenges in the Cloud. Your technical expertise will be vital as you work with our client and various Cyber organizations to ensure standards are met throughout the Cloud migration process. This is an opportunity to use the latest Cloud technologies as you look for ways to improve your customer’s environment using current Cloud capabilities. You’ll be able to sharpen your skills in Cloud-based security and Azure technology while developing critical systems for the DoD. As a technical leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to build Cloud-based solutions to help your customers meet their evolving needs. Join our team as we transform, strengthen, and capitalize on warfighter communication with Cloud technology. Join us. The world can't wait.

title: Dynamics 365 CE Developer
description:
Job Title: Dynamics CE/CRM Developer
Location: Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg, Sweden, Uppsala
Company: Leading Microsoft Gold Partner
Are you a skilled Dynamics CRM Developer ready to deliver innovative CRM solutions that make an impact? Join a renowned Microsoft Gold Partner where you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, collaborate with top professionals, and contribute to transformative projects for high-profile clients.
Your Role:
As a Dynamics CRM Developer, you will:
- Develop and customize Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions to meet client needs.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions.
- Extend CRM functionality through custom code, plugins, workflows, and third-party integrations.
- Conduct unit testing, debugging, and code reviews to ensure quality and performance.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest Dynamics CRM features and provide innovative solutions.
- Create and maintain technical documentation, including design documents and user manuals.
What You'll Need:
- Fluency in Swedish (written and verbal) is essential.
- Proven experience developing and customizing Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions using .NET, C#, JavaScript, and SQL.
- Strong understanding of CRM architecture, including entity relationships, workflows, forms, and security models.
- Hands-on experience with tools like Visual Studio, XRM Toolbox, and the CRM SDK.
- Familiarity with web technologies (HTML, CSS, REST/SOAP web services) and integration tools.
- Knowledge of data migration and CRM integration techniques.
- A degree in Computer Science or a related field (equivalent experience considered).
- Microsoft Dynamics CRM certifications (e.g., MB-210, MB-220, MB-230) are a plus.
- Excellent problem-solving, collaboration, and communication skills.
What's in It for You?
Join a team that values innovation, growth, and work-life balance:
- Competitive Salary: Attractive package with performance-based incentives.
- Health & Wellness: Comprehensive health insurance and wellness programs.
- Flexibility: Hybrid working model with flexible hours.
- Growth Opportunities: Ongoing training, certifications, and professional development.
- Team Culture: Collaborative environment with supportive colleagues and leaders.
- Exciting Projects: Work on prestigious client engagements using the latest technologies.
- Perks: Generous vacation, paid time off, social events, and employee recognition programs.
Why Join Us?
As a Microsoft Gold Partner, we're committed to excellence, innovation, and empowering our employees. You'll have the chance to advance your career while delivering impactful solutions that drive success for our clients.
If you're ready to take the next step in your career as a Dynamics CRM Developer, apply now and become part of a team where your skills and creativity make a difference!

title: Modern Workplace Consultant-AI & Engineering
description:
Join our AI & Engineering team by transforming technology platforms, driving innovation, and helping make a significant impact on our clients' success. You’ll collaborate with talented professionals, reimagining and re-engineering operations and processes that are critical to business. Your contributions can help clients improve financial performance, accelerate new digital ventures, and fuel growth through innovation. AI & Engineering leverages innovative engineering capabilities to build, deploy, and operate integrated/verticalized sector solutions in software, data, AI, network, and hybrid cloud infrastructure. These solutions are powered by engineering for business advantage, transforming mission-critical operations. We enable clients to stay ahead with the latest advancements by transforming engineering teams and modernizing technology & data platforms. Our delivery models are tailored to meet each client's unique requirements.

Our Hybrid Cloud Infrastructure offering delivers specialized engineering capabilities to design, implement, manage, and operate hybrid cloud environments. We modernize networks and AI infrastructure from the core to the edge and develop new infrastructure and device services to help clients stay ahead with the latest technology advancements. The Modern Workplace consultant strives to build an end user experience that enables users to work independently and efficiently adopting cutting edge technologies. Our Modern Workplace team guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of workplace services. We help our clients optimize their workplace experience through collaborative tools that increase productivity and allow seamless communication and collaborations amongst teams. These include transformations for BYOD, mobility, desktop delivery, collaboration, end user experience management, user support environments, Microsoft 365 Copilot implementations, Power Platform development, and virtual desktop infrastructure.

title: Power Apps Developer
description:
Are you passionate about helping organizations digitally transform their operations to achieve mission goals? As a Digital Transformation Specialist, you know that implementing improved digital initiatives with effective process improvements, workflow automations, and data-driven design is crucial for your client’s future. You’re eager to apply your expertise in low-code develop and cross-functional collaboration to design impactful solutions to support digital transformation goals and enhance organizational productivity. We’re looking for someone to harness the power of low-code tools like Power Platform to automate workflows, enhance user experiences, and accelerate digital initiatives across a large organization. We’re looking for someone like you to help organizations solve their traditional business challenges with new digital strategies and solutions.

In this role, you will work as part of a dynamic, cross-functional team alongside project managers to capture business requirements, define solution architectures, and translate them into scalable, low-code applications using Power Platform. You’ll collaborate closely to understand the organization’s business needs, document technical specifications, and lead the development of workflows and integrations with systems like Dataverse, SharePoint, and external APIs. You’ll be responsible for managing security and access within specific Power Platform environments, ensuring that solutions are built and deployed with the appropriate permissions and controls in place. Your technical expertise will be key to creating and deploying intuitive solutions that drive efficiency for a U.S government client.

Success in developing front-end user interfaces, process automations, and data-centric reporting comes down to one thing: learning what an organization’s biggest needs are and how to address those needs with digital solutions. Although many organizations know where they want to go, getting there can be a challenge. Thankfully, that’s what our team excels in – creating digital roadmaps and developing applications, automations, and reports that move organizations forward. It’s why we’re looking for someone like you who can identify solution requirements and provide development support for those solutions to come to life.

In this role, you will be responsible for creating and deploying custom digital solutions with Microsoft Power Platform for a U.S. government client in their Microsoft 365 environment. You will work closely with a senior Power Platform specialist to design and develop low-code/no-code applications to solve client challenges. You will also gather functional requirements from government stakeholders and develop and deploy multiple applications that meet the organization’s business needs and support their strategic goals.
location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Contract Opportunity: Power BI Developer
Rate: £400 per day
Location: 1 day on-site in Preston
Start Date: Immediate
IR35 Status: Outside IR35
Duration: Initial 1 month (likely extension)
We're looking for a highly capable Power BI Developer to support a critical reporting migration project for a leading organisation. This role involves converting a large suite of legacy SQL-to-Excel reports into modern, scalable Power BI dashboards, hosted on a clean and structured AWS Snowflake platform.
Key Responsibilities:
- Migrate and replicate existing SQL-based reports into Power BI
- Develop interactive dashboards and visualisations aligned with business needs
- Write and optimise custom SQL queries where required
- Collaborate with operations teams to clarify reporting logic and requirements
- Ensure all work is clearly documented and handed over to internal teams
- Identify opportunities to streamline and improve reporting processes
Requirements:
- Proven experience with Power BI, SQL, and Snowflake
- Strong understanding of data modelling and visualisation best practices

title: D365 BC Process/Training Lead
description:
Our client is a large, Private Equity backed Dynamics Business Central end customer that is looking to expand the functionality of their ERP system and is in need of a skilled functional resource to support this effort. They have recently grown due to multiple acquisitions in which they are attempting to move their legacy systems to Business Central team. They are building their IT dept. with skilled team members who are looking to keep working in a hands-on capacity, closely supporting users on help desk efforts and managing upgrade projects.

Your New Role:
* Provide technical and functional support for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central in both production and non-production environments.
* You will collaborate closely with internal teams to assess system requests and recommend solutions to enhance operational efficiency.
* Lead business requirement gathering, specification, design, and testing efforts for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 projects.
* Serve as the primary IT contact for Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 technical requirements.
* Manage and maintain the Dynamics 365 Version Upgrade process, including meetings and testing with key business users.
* Create detailed user documentation and training materials for modifications, extensions, and customizations. Provide new user training and support.
* Administer Microsoft 365 tenant settings, including user accounts, licenses, and permissions
* Monitor and maintain the health of Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 services, resolving issues promptly

What You'll Receive:
* $90-125k Base Salary (commensurate on experience)
* Medical, Dental, Vision Plan
* Extensive PTO plan
* 401k
* Remote flexibility (note: must be living in the United States)
* Opportunity to make an impact in an organization that is investing in new technologies
* Major career growth potential as you will have full oversight of the ERP system

Don't miss out. Interviews are already being scheduled.

Interested in learning more? Apply now by sending your resume to m.potenza@nigelfrank.com, or for more information, call Matt at 646-540-7521

title: Dynamics 365 CE Developer
description:
Job Title: Dynamics CE/CRM Developer
Location: Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg, Sweden
Company: Leading Microsoft Gold Partner
Are you a skilled Dynamics CRM Developer ready to deliver innovative CRM solutions that make an impact? Join a renowned Microsoft Gold Partner where you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, collaborate with top professionals, and contribute to transformative projects for high-profile clients.
Your Role:
As a Dynamics CRM Developer, you will:
- Develop and customize Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions to meet client needs.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions.
- Extend CRM functionality through custom code, plugins, workflows, and third-party integrations.
- Conduct unit testing, debugging, and code reviews to ensure quality and performance.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest Dynamics CRM features and provide innovative solutions.
- Create and maintain technical documentation, including design documents and user manuals.
What You'll Need:
- Fluency in Swedish (written and verbal) is essential.
- Proven experience developing and customizing Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions using .NET, C#, JavaScript, and SQL.
- Strong understanding of CRM architecture, including entity relationships, workflows, forms, and security models.
- Hands-on experience with tools like Visual Studio, XRM Toolbox, and the CRM SDK.
- Familiarity with web technologies (HTML, CSS, REST/SOAP web services) and integration tools.
- Knowledge of data migration and CRM integration techniques.
- A degree in Computer Science or a related field (equivalent experience considered).
- Microsoft Dynamics CRM certifications (e.g., MB-210, MB-220, MB-230) are a plus.
- Excellent problem-solving, collaboration, and communication skills.
What's in It for You?
Join a team that values innovation, growth, and work-life balance:
- Competitive Salary: Attractive package with performance-based incentives.
- Health & Wellness: Comprehensive health insurance and wellness programs.
- Flexibility: Hybrid working model with flexible hours.
- Growth Opportunities: Ongoing training, certifications, and professional development.
- Team Culture: Collaborative environment with supportive colleagues and leaders.
- Exciting Projects: Work on prestigious client engagements using the latest technologies.
- Perks: Generous vacation, paid time off, social events, and employee recognition programs.
Why Join Us?
As a Microsoft Gold Partner, we're committed to excellence, innovation, and empowering our employees. You'll have the chance to advance your career while delivering impactful solutions that drive success for our clients.
If you're ready to take the next step in your career as a Dynamics CRM Developer, apply now and become part of a team where your skills and creativity make a difference!

title: D365 BC Trainer/Functional Consultant - Remote USA - $125k
description:
Business Central Trainer/Functional Consultant - Remote USA - $125k
Our client is a large, Private Equity backed Dynamics Business Central end customer that is looking to expand the functionality of their ERP system and is in need of a skilled functional resource to support this effort. They have recently grown due to multiple acquisitions in which they are attempting to move their legacy systems to Business Central team. They are building their IT dept. with skilled team members who are looking to keep working in a hands-on capacity, closely supporting users on help desk efforts and managing upgrade projects.
Your New Role:
- Provide technical and functional support for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central in both production and non-production environments.
- You will collaborate closely with internal teams to assess system requests and recommend solutions to enhance operational efficiency.
- Lead business requirement gathering, specification, design, and testing efforts for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 projects.
- Serve as the primary IT contact for Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 technical requirements.
- Manage and maintain the Dynamics 365 Version Upgrade process, including meetings and testing with key business users.
- Create detailed user documentation and training materials for modifications, extensions, and customizations. Provide new user training and support.
- Administer Microsoft 365 tenant settings, including user accounts, licenses, and permissions
- Monitor and maintain the health of Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 services, resolving issues promptly
What You'll Receive:
- $90-125k Base Salary (commensurate on experience)
- Medical, Dental, Vision Plan
- Extensive PTO plan
- 401k
- Remote flexibility (note: must be living in the United States)
- Opportunity to make an impact in an organization that is investing in new technologies
- Major career growth potential as you will have full oversight of the ERP system
Don't miss out. Interviews are already being scheduled.
Interested in learning more? Apply now by sending your resume to m.potenza@nigelfrank.com, or for more information, call Matt at 646-540-7521

title: ERP Project Manager (D365 Business Central)
description:
ERP Project Manager - Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

The Opportunity
I am actively seeking an enthusiastic Project Manager, with experience delivering end to end Dynamics 365 ERP projects, for a brilliant new role within the UK Microsoft partner channel. The successful candidate will take the lead on a range of exciting, greenfield Dynamics 365 Business Central projects - all whilst working within a supportive environment and offering the autonomy to really drive projects.

A base salary up to £70,000 is on offer, as well as numerous company perks - operating a home working model with expectation of occasional on-site travel; project phase dependant.

Responsibilities for this role will involve:
- Managing the full project life cycle of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central implementations
- Budget/ resource/ time frame management and developing all relevant project documentation
- Ensuring the successful delivery of systems to customers tailored project requirements.
- Involvement in project governance at a group level to ensure delivery best practice

For this role, my client is looking for:
- A proven track record in ERP system Project Management; D365 Business Central experience highly preferable
- Demonstrable full project life cycle management experience; from kick off to go-live
- Ability to get hands on in system/ process analysis phases, working closely with consultants
- Solid methodology expertise (AGILE/ Waterfall understanding preferable)
- Project management certifications (eg. PMP, Prince2) - preferable, not essential
- Excellent communication/ stakeholder engagement skills

What does the role offer?
- The opportunity to autonomously lead several fantastic D365 BC projects and grow your experience within the MS ecosystem
- A competitive starting salary up to £70,000
- 25 Days Holiday and company benefits scheme
- Further professional development/ training openings
- Brilliant company team events/ employee incentive schemes

title: D365 Business Central Systems Analyst
description:
Our client is a large, Private Equity backed Dynamics Business Central end customer that is looking to expand the functionality of their ERP system and is in need of a skilled functional resource to support this effort. They have recently grown due to multiple acquisitions in which they are attempting to move their legacy systems to Business Central team. They are building their IT dept. with skilled team members who are looking to keep working in a hands-on capacity, closely supporting users on help desk efforts and managing upgrade projects.

Your New Role:
- Provide technical and functional support for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central in both production and non-production environments.
- You will collaborate closely with internal teams to assess system requests and recommend solutions to enhance operational efficiency.
- Lead business requirement gathering, specification, design, and testing efforts for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 projects.
- Serve as the primary IT contact for Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 technical requirements.
- Manage and maintain the Dynamics 365 Version Upgrade process, including meetings and testing with key business users.
- Create detailed user documentation and training materials for modifications, extensions, and customizations. Provide new user training and support.
- Administer Microsoft 365 tenant settings, including user accounts, licenses, and permissions
- Monitor and maintain the health of Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 services, resolving issues promptly

Plan de carrera claro y acompañamiento real al desarrollo profesional. 100% remoto (se valora residencia en España para visitas puntuales a cliente). title: Senior BC Consultant - Finance
description:
Senior Business Central Consultant (Finance)
Location: Copenhagen
Salary: Competitive
Work Model: Hybrid (2-3 days onsite per week preferred)
Vacation: 6 weeks
Start Date: ASAP (Hiring now with June start preferred)

Drive Transformation in the Retail Sector
Our Client is a leading Danish IT company delivering vertical Microsoft Dynamics 365 POS and e-commerce solutions to global retail, museum, and attraction businesses. With over 135 employees across Denmark, Serbia, Croatia, Mauritius, and Sweden, we provide end-to-end omnichannel solutions built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.

As we expand into the private sector, we're looking for an experienced Senior Business Central Consultant with a strong financial background to help lead implementation projects with high-profile clients like Legoland.

What You'll Do
- Deliver consultancy services across analysis, solution design, scoping, implementation, and training
- Work closely with key retail clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions
- Collaborate with developers and other consultants to ensure project success
- Learn and leverage their industry-specific BC solutions
- Provide finance-focused input throughout projects (bookkeeping, tax from the client perspective, credit/debit structures)

What We're Looking For
- 5+ years' experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (or close to it)
- Strong understanding of financial processes within BC
- Fluent in Danish (spoken and written)
- Experience in external consultancy or the retail sector is a plus, but not required
- Self-motivated and able to thrive in a hybrid, collaborative environment

What We Offer
- Competitive salary
- 6 weeks' paid vacation and pension contribution
- A hybrid work model with flexibility and autonomy
- The opportunity to work with high-profile clients and make a visible impact
- A collaborative and supportive team culture with colleagues across Europe and beyond
- The potential to work from any of our global offices (e.g., Mauritius, Serbia)

About the Team
You'll be joining a team of 5 consultants and 10 developers based in CPH, part of a broader BC division of 15 professionals. The client is known for its innovation, international mindset, and people-first culture.

Ready to make your mark? Apply today to join a company where your expertise drives success—and your work-life balance is a priority.

title: ERP Operations Manager (Business Central)
description:
ERP Operations Manager (Business Central) - Irving, TX

Job Opportunity: ERP Operations Manager/Lead (Business Central - Manufacturing)
Location: Irving, TX (Onsite)
Full-Time | Discrete Manufacturing Industry

About Us:
This client is a market-leading discrete manufacturing company known for innovation, precision, and operational excellence. As they continue to scale and modernize their operations, they are seeking an ERP Operations Manager/Lead to spearhead their ERP strategy and execution with a strong focus on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and manufacturing process optimization expertise.

Role Overview:
As the ERP Operations Manager/Lead, you will be the strategic and operational owner of the Dynamics Business Central ERP ecosystem. You will lead cross-functional teams of business analysts in the US as well as offshore, drive continuous improvement, and ensure seamless integration of Business Central across their manufacturing operations reporting to the VP, IT.

title: Business Central Accounting Systems Analyst
description:
D365 Business Central Accounting Systems Analyst - $125k - NYC - Remote
Our client is a large, Private Equity backed Dynamics Business Central end customer that is looking to expand the functionality of their ERP system and is in need of a skilled functional resource to support this effort. They have recently grown due to multiple acquisitions in which they are attempting to move their legacy systems to Business Central team. They are building their IT dept. with skilled team members who are looking to keep working in a hands-on capacity, closely supporting users on help desk efforts and managing upgrade projects.
Your New Role:
* Provide technical and functional support for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central in both production and non-production environments.
* You will collaborate closely with internal teams to assess system requests and recommend solutions to enhance operational efficiency.
* Lead business requirement gathering, specification, design, and testing efforts for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 projects.
* Serve as the primary IT contact for Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 technical requirements.
* Manage and maintain the Dynamics 365 Version Upgrade process, including meetings and testing with key business users.
* Create detailed user documentation and training materials for modifications, extensions, and customizations. Provide new user training and support.
* Administer Microsoft 365 tenant settings, including user accounts, licenses, and permissions
* Monitor and maintain the health of Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 services, resolving issues promptly
What You'll Receive:
* $90-130k Base Salary (commensurate on experience)
* Medical, Dental, Vision Plan
* Extensive PTO plan
* 401k
* Remote flexibility (note: must be living in the United States)
* Opportunity to make an impact in an organization that is investing in new technologies
* Major career growth potential as you will have full oversight of the ERP system
Don't miss out. Interviews are already being scheduled.
Interested in learning more?
Apply now by sending your resume to m.potenza@nigelfrank.com, or for more information, call Matt at 646-540-7521

title: CE Application Consultant (Functional consultant)
description:
Job Title: D365 CE / CRM Functional Application Consultant Location: Hybrid - Stockholm, Sweden Job Type: Permanent Experience: 2+ Years
Are you a solution-focused Functional Consultant with hands-on experience in Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CRM)? An established and growing organisation in Stockholm is looking for a D365 CE Functional Application Consultant to join their digital transformation journey.
This hybrid role offers the opportunity to work both on-site and remotely, providing flexibility while staying connected with a collaborative team.
What You'll Do:
- Engage with business users to understand requirements and translate them into effective D365 CE solutions
- Configure and customise Dynamics 365 CE applications based on specific client needs
- Lead and contribute to full project life cycles - from discovery to deployment and support
- Deliver user workshops, training, and documentation to ensure adoption
- Collaborate with technical teams to align solutions with broader business systems
- Stay informed on the latest Microsoft and Power Platform updates and best practices
What You'll Bring:
- 2+ years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE / CRM
- Proven background in functional implementation and configuration
- Strong understanding of business processes across sales, marketing, or customer service
- Comfortable working in agile environments with multiple stakeholders
- Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities
- Fluent in Swedish
Bonus if:
- Exposure to Power Platform, including Power Apps and Power Automate
- Microsoft certifications in Dynamics 365 or related technologies
- Experience working with clients in Sweden or the Nordic region

title: Senior Dynamics Developer
description:
Senior Dynamics Developer - Northampton (Hybrid - 2 days a week)
Our client are an established D365 CRM End User who are seeking a Senior Dynamics Developer to play a critical role in the design, development and delivery of D365 Customer Engagement. You'll be required to work closely with stakeholders across the business, driving the technical evolution of their CRM platform and acting as a key contributor in their growing in-house team!
Responsibilities -
- Lead the design and development of custom Dynamics 365 CE solutions
- Work closely with business analysts, architects, and users to gather requirements and translate them into scalable technical solutions
- Customise and configure Dynamics modules, workflows, and plugins using C#, JavaScript, Power Automate, and Power Platform
- Integrate D365 CE with other business systems and third-party applications
- Establish development best practices, coding standards, and DevOps processes for the Dynamics environment
- Provide mentorship and guidance to junior developers as the team grows
- Contribute to the long-term strategy for CRM and customer experience capabilities
Experience -
- Proven experience developing and supporting Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE/CRM
- Strong proficiency in C#, JavaScript, Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps), and Azure services
- Experience with Dynamics 365, Plugin development, and Custom Workflows
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a proactive and collaborative approach
- Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
- Experience working for end users or with end user-focused solutions is a strong plus
Benefits -
- Starting Salary - up to £75k dependant on experience.
- Flexible, Hybrid working model - 2 Days a week in Northampton.
- Life assurance, enhanced pension contributions & more.

title: Senior Business Central Consultant (Finance)
description:
Drive Transformation in the Retail Sector
Our Client is a leading Danish IT company delivering vertical Microsoft Dynamics 365 POS and e-commerce solutions to global retail, museum, and attraction businesses. With over 135 employees across Denmark, Serbia, Croatia, Mauritius, and Sweden, we provide end-to-end omnichannel solutions built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.
As we expand into the private sector, we're looking for an experienced Senior Business Central Consultant with a strong financial background to help lead implementation projects with high-profile clients like Legoland.
What You'll Do
- Deliver consultancy services across analysis, solution design, scoping, implementation, and training
- Work closely with key retail clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions
- Collaborate with developers and other consultants to ensure project success
- Learn and leverage their industry-specific BC solutions
- Provide finance-focused input throughout projects (bookkeeping, tax from the client perspective, credit/debit structures)
What We're Looking For
- 5+ years' experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (or close to it)
- Strong understanding of financial processes within BC
- Fluent in Danish (spoken and written)
- Experience in external consultancy or the retail sector is a plus, but not required
- Self-motivated and able to thrive in a hybrid, collaborative environment
What We Offer

title: Dynamics 365 Business Central Developer
description: Dynamics 365 Business Central Developer 7525-070122-1_1753804825 Developer - Dynamics 365 Business Central! My client continues their growth journey and as a result are looking for developers to join their office in Umea. As a developer, you will work on exciting projects together with successful customers and awesome colleagues who always strive for high quality in what they do! You also get colleagues who always support you and help you to constantly develop yourself and in your role as a consultant. As a developer, you are technically responsible for the solutions we build. You lead the development work in the various projects with our customers. You are part of a team of consultants who have a close dialogue with our customers, you have a central role in the projects we deliver. You also assist your colleagues in the team with technical know-how in the development parts in the Dynamics projects. The projects we work on are both new system implementations and continuous development of our customer's existing systems. This also includes the development of integrations and surrounding applications. For the right person, there is also the opportunity to eventually lead our development work within the company and formulate the guidelines for our continued technical development. The development takes place in the programming language AL, which is a language specially developed for Dynamics 365 Business Central. The development takes place in the development environment Visual Studio Code, which is a modern and very popular IDE. Who are we looking for? You have at least a couple of years of experience in Development. If you have experience from development in business systems, this is an advantage, but not a requirement. The most important thing is your personal qualities. We believe that you have a positive attitude towards learning new things and driven to constantly develop further in your professional role. As a person, we believe that you are committed and driven to deliver solutions that improve our customer's operations. You will get to work with the latest technology in Business Systems together with successful customers in various industries. We are an entrepreneurial company with high ceilings that offers great freedom and great opportunities to develop as a consultant. We offer good terms and a lot of benefits. Do not hesitate to send your application and take the next step in your career together with a company and a system of the future.

title: CRM Support Exec
description:
Dynamics 365 System Administrator - Location(s) - London, Manchester, Birmingham and more (Hybrid - 3 days a week). Our client is seeking a skilled Dynamics 365 System Administrator to join their company in a really exciting period of growth and to work on a major upcoming digital transformation.

Roles and Responsibilities
System Configuration and Maintenance
- Manage and configure Dynamics 365 CE environments, including sandbox and production instances.
- Customize entities, forms, views, dashboards, workflows, business process flows, and security roles.
- Implement updates, patches, and upgrades while ensuring system stability and data integrity.
User Management and Support:
- Manage user accounts, licenses, roles, and permissions to maintain security and compliance.
- Provide day-to-day support to end users, troubleshoot issues, and coordinate with Microsoft support when necessary.
- Develop and maintain user documentation and training materials to promote self-service and adoption
Integration and Data Management:
- Oversee integrations with other enterprise systems (ERP, marketing automation, BI tools, etc.).
- Manage data import/export processes, data cleansing
- Ensure data security, compliance, and governance policies are enforced.
Customisation and Development Liaison:
- Work with developers to manage custom plugins, workflows, and API integrations.
- Review and test customisation to ensure quality and system performance.
- Evaluate and recommend third-party solutions or apps from Microsoft AppSource.
Monitoring and Reporting:
- Monitor system performance, usage, and errors using available tools and analytics.
- Generate and distribute system health reports and usage metrics to leadership.
- Continuously assess and optimise system configurations to improve user experience and business outcomes.
Governance and Compliance:
- Enforce organisational policies on data privacy, security, and regulatory compliance within the D365 environment.
- Manage audit logs, security settings, and user activity monitoring.
- Participate in internal and external audits related to CRM systems.
