title: Microsoft Azure AI / Artificial Intelligence Architect / Lead
description:
Microsoft Azure AI / Artificial Intelligence Architect / Lead

Technical Responsibilities
- Own the end-to-end design and rollout of AI solutions that accelerate sales forecasting, quote generation, and marketing content creation.
- Map current processes in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (BC); identify data sources, gaps, and integration points for AI.
- Architect and implement Azure-based services (Azure OpenAI Service, Cognitive Services, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory, Synapse, Functions, Logic Apps) to ingest data, train models, and deploy scalable, secure APIs.
- Build and maintain reusable forecasting and CPQ models, prompt libraries, and generative-content templates; establish CI/CD and MLOps pipelines.
- Define and enforce AI governance: data quality standards, versioning, telemetry, bias mitigation, security, and Responsible AI compliance.
- Lead backlog grooming, sprint planning, and cross-functional collaboration with product, marketing, and IT; serve as the technical lead for adoption of AI across the organization
- Track and report performance metrics (latency, accuracy, ROI) and continuously optimize models and workflows.

Required Skills & Experience
- Successful track record of delivering data analytics / software solutions, with recent lead role(s) in production AI/ML and/or generative-AI deployments.
- Deep expertise in Azure AI stack (Azure OpenAI, Cognitive Services, Azure Machine Learning, Data Lake, Synapse, Data Factory) and in designing secure, high-availability cloud architectures.
- Hands-on knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central APIs, AL extensions, and Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps, Copilot Studio, Dataverse).
- Strong programming background (Python, SQL) and proficiency with Git-based CI/CD, RESTful API design, and serverless/event-driven patterns.
- Proven delivery of forecasting, CPQ, or marketing-content AI solutions at enterprise scale; fluency in prompt engineering, retrieval-augmented generation, and vector databases (e.g., Azure Cosmos DB, Elastic).
- Experience standing up MLOps frameworks (MLflow, Azure ML pipelines) and monitoring for model drift, data shifts, and cost efficiency.
- Solid grasp of data governance, privacy (GDPR/CCPA), security best practices, and Responsible AI principles.
- Exceptional stakeholder-management and leadership skills; adept at evangelizing new technology and mentoring engineers in an agile environment.

This position is on-site in Dallas, specifically in the vicinity of Grapevine so candidates must be local, and willing to work onsite 5 days per week.

title: Power BI Developer - Insurance
description: A specialist reinsurance broker are looking for a Power BI enthusiast to join their growing team in Central London - hybrid working, with 2-3 days per week in the office. The business is relatively "new" to the market, meaning they have no legacy systems, and they are incredibly digitally driven - they truly are a modern broker built for today's world, with incredibly forward-thinking working practices. Working within the Data team, you will lead on the end-to-end delivery of insightful Power BI reporting solutions for various stakeholders on a global scale. This will involve scoping and gathering requirements, developing the solution itself, and then delivering actionable business insights. So whilst this is a very technical role, it will also involve lots of stakeholder engagement, and would be well-suited to someone who enjoys working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You'll also get involved in Data Engineering projects - they're currently operating on an Azure Data Platform, with plans to move to a multi-cloud platform using Google Cloud later this year - offering the chance to broaden your skills with new and emerging technologies! This is a brilliant opportunity for a data professional to join a business who truly are at the leading-edge of their field, and who are committed to leveraging technology to fuel their growth.

title: ERP Implementation/Program Lead (D365 F&O)
description:
F&O Implementation Lead | Sydney-Based End User | Greenfield ERP Program | 2 days on site 3 WFH
An exciting opportunity has opened with a Sydney-based end user at the very beginning of their greenfield Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O) implementation. They are seeking an experienced F&O Implementation Lead to drive the delivery of this major business transformation from the inside. Ideally you'll either be a Lead Consultant or a Solution Architect with multiple D365 F&O implementations under your belt - however, the client would also consider any Program/Project Managers that have previous F&O implementation experience that was hands on.
Greenfield end user roles like this are incredibly rare - this is your chance to join early and make a tangible, strategic impact on a company-wide ERP rollout. To be considered you must have exceptional communications and stake holder management skills.
Why this role?
- Be the internal lead on a high-profile greenfield ERP program
- Influence vendor selection and implementation approach
- Own internal stakeholder engagement, solution alignment, and program direction
- Collaborate with senior leadership, finance, operations, and external partners
- Clear long-term career pathway beyond D365 - potential to step into broader leadership roles
Your Role:
As the F&O Implementation Lead, you'll serve as the internal face of the ERP transformation - coordinating between business stakeholders, executive sponsors, and the selected implementation partner. You'll drive project planning, solution delivery, and governance, ensuring the program delivers lasting value across the organisation.
This is a standout opportunity to lead a high-impact ERP program from the inside. If you're a delivery-focused F&O professional with the ability to bridge technical, operational, and stakeholder needs.

responsibilities: ['Lead internal ownership of the D365 F&O implementation from initiation through go-live.', 'Collaborate with and manage relationships with external implementation partners.', 'Partner with key stakeholders to align business requirements and solution design.', 'Support vendor selection process and influence architectural decisions.', 'Oversee project timelines, resource planning, risks, and reporting.', 'Ensure the solution meets business needs and is adopted successfully across teams.']
qualifications: ['Previous experience delivering full life-cycle Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O implementations.', 'Strong understanding of F&O modules and ERP project delivery frameworks.', 'Background in functional consulting, solution design, or hands-on implementation.', 'Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.', 'Ability to manage vendors, align internal teams, and drive program momentum.', 'A strategic mindset and interest in long-term career growth beyond the ERP space.']

title: D365 BC Solutions Manager
description:
D365 Business Central Solutions Manager - Baltimore/Remote - $150k
Are you a hands-on ERP Project Manager looking to join a company with a great culture? This is the opportunity for you. Our client, a publishing industry Dynamics 365 Business Central end user, is looking for a Business Solutions Manager to lead a series of ongoing integration, improvement, and upgrade projects on a constantly evolving system. We are looking for someone who is up to date on the latest and greatest in Microsoft Dynamics, Azure, and the Power Platform; an Agile Delivery Lead who can both manage teams and step in where need be on configuration and support efforts.

Your New Company:
- Leading scientific and medical search publishing organization with a national presence
- A mission-driven, employee centric organization with a fun company culture and excellent work/life balance
- A well-established organization who is putting a heavy investment in their technology infrastructure, focused on continuous improvement
- A community focused organization who believes in giving back as one of their highest priorities

Your New Role:
- Lead ERP strategy, upgrades, and cloud migrations
- Drive Agile delivery across sprints and roadmaps
- Collaborate with stakeholders and tech teams
- Manage integrations, technical debt, and innovation
- Present insights to execs and guide transformation
- Oversee a technical team, working closely with stakeholders on systems and process improvements

What You'll Need:
- 5+ years of experience in managing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central solutions, including at least 2 Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central upgrade and implementations completed
- Expert finance and accounting process knowledge
- Experience with supply chain and EDI integrations preferred, not required
- PMP or Scrum Master certification a big plus
- Expertise in Microsoft Azure, including cloud infrastructure, security, and integrations.
- Strong proficiency in Microsoft Power Platform, especially Microsoft Power Apps for low-code application development.
- 5+ years in a team leadership capacity

What You'll Receive:
- Competitive base salary ($135-150k range)
- Remote flexibility with limited travel (note: certain state restrictions are in place)
- Excellent benefits and PTO plan
- Amazing work/life balance (less than 40 hours most weeks)
- Career growth potential with the opportunity to work on an exciting project pipeline

title: Project Manager - Enterprise Solutions (MS Technology)
description:
My client, a MNC company with offices in 100+ countries, is seeking an APAC Project Manager with a good IT knowledge in Enterprise Solutions (especially for latest Microsoft Technology). Opportunities such as this are not around every day, and if you are qualified do not hesitate to take the next step upwards in your career!

Responsibilities:
- Lead the regional IT team to manage large-scale IT projects that span across multiple business streams in APAC.
- Responsible for the full spectrum of end-to-end project delivery, such as Road-map Design, Solution Design, Budget, Timeline, Deliverable and Service Vendor management.
- Be a key contributor on project governance standards and processes for all APAC projects.
- Co-ordinate and manage onshore / offshore teams with their assignments, user stories, and acceptance criteria along with execution plans.
- Understand business needs and able to propose appropriate IT solutions to Top Management.
- Ability to lead and motivate a team, able to mitigate risks, resource management and drive tactical plans.
- Work closely with the Senior IT Leadership team and provide support to junior members including knowledge sharing and lead by example.
- Ensure knowledge sharing on both project management and technical know-how between project/ cross-functional teams.

- Degree or above holder in Computer Science or IT related discipline.
- Knowledge in Microsoft products such as Dynamics 365 CE / CRM, Dynamics 365 F&O /AX, Azure Cloud, SQL Database, .NET, O365, Power Apps etc. is preferred
- Proven track record in managing strategic global solutions delivery, strong management skills including project management, financial management, change management and facilitation.
- Experience in leading & managing the (onshore and offshore) team along with multiple concurrent projects delivery.
- Strong experience / knowledge in both traditional waterfall methodology as well as more modern Agile / iterative methods
- Experience in Regional role and solution roll-out will be highly advantageous.
- Be reliable, accountable and with excellent ability to communicate effectively to all levels of the business and technical resources.
- Good command of spoken and written English and Chinese

They are offering a competitive salary and benefits package, depends on your experience and skill. Any enquires please feel free to call Ruby at +852 3018 0380 or email Ruby by r.zhang@tenthrevolution.com.

title: Dynamics 365 CRM Trainer
description:
Dynamics 365 CRM Trainer - New York / Remote - $125,000
About Us: Our client is a billion dollar private equity backed Microsoft Dynamics end user that has grown rapidly over the past year through a series of acquisitions and is heavily investing in their IT infrastructure.
Role: Microsoft Dynamics Trainer
Are you a Microsoft Dynamics whiz with a knack for teaching? Do you thrive on the road and love the idea of empowering teams with cutting-edge CRM and Field Service skills? If so, we want you!
What You'll Do:
- Lead the Charge: Conduct engaging training sessions for our sales, service dispatch, and admin teams, both remotely and on-site.
- Create Magic: Develop and maintain top-notch training materials - think user guides, tutorials, and hands-on workshops.
- Be the Go-To Guru: Provide ongoing support post go-live, helping users navigate Dynamics CRM and Field Service like pros.
- Onboard Like a Pro: Ensure new employees hit the ground running with Microsoft Dynamics from day one.
- Collaborate and Innovate: Work with IT teams, project managers, and business leaders to align training with deployment schedules and gather feedback to refine programs.
- Test and Perfect: Assist with functional testing of new features and updates, providing valuable feedback to IT.
What You Bring:
- Proven experience delivering user training for Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Field Service, or similar platforms.
- A flair for creating engaging training materials, including manuals, quick reference guides, and workshop exercises.
- Excellent communication skills - you can simplify complex system functions into clear, concise instructions.
- Hands-on experience in user support, troubleshooting, and providing hyper-care post go-live.
- A willingness to travel extensively within the United States (~50% of the time).
- A problem-solving mindset with a focus on user experience and operational efficiency.
- Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple training engagements independently.
- A Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Education, Business Administration, or a related field.
- At least 5 years of experience in training roles involving CRM and Field Service applications, preferably with Microsoft Dynamics CRM.
- Experience supporting user acceptance testing (UAT) or functional system testing is a plus.
Salary / Benefits:
- $90-125k base salary
- Top-tier benefits package
- Excellent career growth potential
- Remote flexibility (Note: Need someone willing to travel up to 50%)
- Become part of a fun, fast-paced company where you can make impact in a growing IT department

title: Senior Business Central Developer
description:
Senior Business Central Developer - Miami - $130k - Remote Flex
Our client is a leading Microsoft ISV specializing in cloud-based accounting automation solutions built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. We are committed to innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction, and we're looking for a talented developer to help shape the future of our products.
What You'll Do:
- Analyze, design, and develop new features for our client's product suite on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (SaaS).
- Maintain and enhance existing codebases across multiple BC versions.
- Implement customer-driven enhancements with a focus on scalability and compliance.
- Collaborate with Product Managers and cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, standardized solutions.
- Develop and maintain RDLC reports and integrations with partner systems.
- Support internal teams with technical expertise and assist in resolving complex customer issues.
- Participate in testing, documentation, and continuous improvement of development processes.
What You Bring:
- Several years of experience in Business Central (SaaS & On-Prem) development.
- Strong skills in AL and C#, with a solid understanding of software architecture and design.
- Experience with cloud migrations and international SaaS product development.
- Familiarity with Microsoft Azure, SQL Server, Docker, Azure DevOps, and web services.
- Knowledge of automated testing and modern DevOps practices.
- Excellent English communication skills
- Strong analytical thinking, independence, and a proactive mindset.
- A passion for quality, customer-centric development, and continuous learning.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Associate or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
- Experience mentoring junior developers.
- Interest in payroll, time tracking, or HR software is a plus.
Why Join Us?
- Competitive base salary ($130-150k)
- Excellent benefits
- Extensive Paid Time Off / Vacation package
- Experience an organization where you can make a difference not only to their customers but also in improving their ISV product
- Work on a product used by thousands of businesses globally.
- Be part of a collaborative, remote-first team that values innovation and autonomy.
- Enjoy a flat hierarchy, flexible work culture, and opportunities for growth.

title: Finance BA/Functional Consultant
description:
F&O Business Analyst - CPA/Finance Background | Sydney-Based End User | Rare Greenfield Opportunity
Are you a finance professional with Microsoft Dynamics F&O experience and a passion for transformation? We're working with a Sydney-based end user at the very start of their greenfield Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O) implementation - and they're looking for an experienced Business Analyst with a CPA or strong finance background to join their program from day one.
Greenfield end user roles like this are extremely rare in today's market, I predict this won't stay on the market for long.
To be considered you MUST have strong stakeholder management/communications skills and previous F&O implementation experience.
Why this role?
- Work on a greenfield ERP transformation (moving from Oracle to Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O).
- Join early and influence the solution design, delivery approach, and stakeholder alignment.
- Work closely with internal finance teams and external partners.
- Build long-term ERP capability with a supportive, growing team.
- Hybrid flexibility and a stable, values-driven organisation (2 days in office 3 WFH)
What you'll be doing:
- Act as a key liaison between finance stakeholders and the technical implementation team.
- Gather, analyse, and document business and functional requirements.
- Support the design and configuration of Finance modules in D365 F&O.
- Assist in testing, training, and adoption across finance functions.
- Ensure alignment between business goals and solution delivery throughout the project.
What we're looking for:
- CPA or equivalent finance qualification.
- At least one full end-to-end F&O implementation (ideally as a Business Analyst or Consultant).
- Strong knowledge of core finance processes: GL, AP, AR, Fixed Assets, Budgeting, etc.
- Exceptional stakeholder management and communication skills - highly valued by the business.
- A hands-on, proactive approach and a passion for driving change.

title: FP&A Analyst - Business Central ERP
description:
FP&A Analyst w/ D365 BC Implementation Exp. - NYC - $135k
Our client is a Dynamics 365 Business Central end user in the retail space that is undergoing a digital transformation initiative and is in need of someone who will play a key role in upgrading their analytics platform following their ERP implementation.
We are in need of a business savvy, finance focused individual with a background on Microsoft Dynamics ERP systems as well as heavy knowledge of Power BI. This would bridge the gap between the company's IT and Finance departments, and in the long-term identifying areas of improvement within the whole business by leveraging key data across multiple divisions.
Tired of feeling like a cog in the machine? Are you ready to make a difference?
Then this is your opportunity to make an impact with a growing cosmetics and consumer products company that is getting ready to make a heavy investment in their IT infrastructure. We are looking for someone with the perfect blend of Financial Analysis, Accounting, Database Management, and ERP Implementation experience to drive this project and eventually build out their financial systems processes.

title: D365 BC Functional Consultant-$125K - Atlanta/Remote
description:
A growing Microsoft Partner is looking for an ERP Functional Consultant with experience configuring and implementing Dynamics 365 Business Central systems. This role will work closely with customer stakeholders, especially in the finance and supply chain departments, to define and configure business processes in conjunction with the ERP that will maximize output. We need someone with experience in a user facing role who is able to translate technical concepts to non-technical personnel.

Your New Role:
- Act as a key member of the ERP implementation team, being part of the project from requirements gathering to post go-live support
- Work alongside customer stakeholders in understanding their business needs and designing a system that fits these requirements
- Troubleshoot any system errors and identify paths for improvement
- Collaborate with a development team on designing a technical blueprint and with customization
- Train and support key users both at customer sites and remotely
- Manage upgrades and integrations with ISV products and reporting tools

What You'll Need:
- 2+ years of Business Central experience
- Business Central implementation experience is a plus
- Prior consulting experience in the Microsoft Partner channel preferred, not required
- Experience with Jet Reports or Power Bi desired, not required
- General knowledge of GAAP, FP&A processes, etc. and the ability to interface with finance dept. professionals
- Excellent communication and customer service skills

What You'll Receive:
- $100-120k base salary
- Excellent bonus potential
- Training and certifications paid for by the company
- PTO Plan and Benefits package
- Medical, Dental, Vision Plan
- 401 (K) Plan with a company match
- Awesome work-life balance
- Stable organization with low employee turnover
- Hybrid schedule with low travel

To apply, please contact Matt Potenza at m.potenza@nigelfrank.com or call 646-540-7521 to find out more.

title: IT manager
description: Lead and manage the internal IT team, including ERP, EDI, administration, and technical support staff (U.S. and Mexico). Oversee and maintain the company's ERP system (Microsoft Dynamics 365, F&O preferred) - including planning, feature scoping, development, testing, implementation, and code moves. Provide day-to-day IT support and ensure alignment with business operations across distribution, warehousing, and manufacturing. Collaborate with senior management to assess business needs and define IT priorities and roadmaps. Manage all aspects of new IT projects: scoping, kickoff, design, development, testing, implementation, training, and change management. Ensure that all IT initiatives stay on time and within approved budgets. Support and maintain EDI production systems and enterprise integration efforts. Research and recommend IT solutions, tools, and infrastructure upgrades. Provide hands-on technical support, training, and report development as needed. Ensure alignment and communication across cross-functional teams and international locations (Canada and Monterrey, Mexico). Maintain best practices in IT operations and foster a forward-thinking data-driven environment.

title: Business Central Accounting SME - Chicago / Remote - $125k
description:
Do you speak fluent accounting and ERP? Can you explain journal entries without putting your audience to sleep? We're looking for a Business Central Accounting/Finance SME who can train users, streamline processes, and keep our financial systems running smoother than a reconciled bank statement. This hybrid role is perfect for someone who's a former Accountant turned ERP whisperer, and part process improvement enthusiast. Occasional travel is required-yes, we'll cover the snacks.

What You'll Be Doing
ERP Training & Support
- Design and deliver training that's informative, engaging, and maybe even fun.
- Create user-friendly SOPs and quick guides (no 50-page manuals, we promise).
- Provide support before, during, and after ERP go-lives-cape optional.

Accounting & Financial Systems
- Be the go-to expert for GL, AR/AP, bank recs, fixed assets, and more.
- Ensure processes align with GAAP and internal controls.
- Support month-end close, audits, and reporting directly in Business Central.

Process Development & Optimization
- Analyze workflows and recommend ERP-based improvements.
- Automate repetitive tasks so humans can focus on the smart stuff.
- Translate business needs into ERP configurations that actually work.

ERP Go-Live & Implementation
- Participate in all phases of ERP projects.
- Lead training and support during go-lives (and keep the panic to a minimum).
- Document lessons learned and share your wisdom.

Collaboration & Communication
- Work cross-functionally with finance, operations, and IT.
- Be the translator between "accounting speak" and "tech talk."

This job offers a competitive salary and benefits package, along with opportunities for professional growth and development, and a hybrid work schedule. Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence.

title: 365 Finance & Supply Chain Management Solution Architect
description:
D365 F&O SCM Senior Consultant/Architect
Location: Vaxjo
We are currently supporting a leading organisation in their search for a D365 F&O SCM Senior Consultant. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced professional to play a key role in the design, implementation, and optimisation of Supply Chain Management (SCM) solutions within Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (D365 F&O).
Key Responsibilities:
- Lead the design, configuration, and deployment of D365 F&O Supply Chain Management (SCM) modules, including Inventory Management, Procurement & Sourcing, Sales & Marketing, and Warehouse Management.
- Collaborate with clients to analyze business processes, gather requirements, and deliver tailored solutions aligned with industry best practices.
- Provide strategic guidance and mentorship to client teams and junior consultants throughout the project lifecycle.
- Manage stakeholder relationships, offering expert advice on D365 F&O SCM functionalities and best practices.
- Conduct workshops, training sessions, and presentations to support client adoption and change management.
- Develop and maintain functional and technical documentation, including user stories, business process models, and system requirements.
- Work closely with development teams to customize and enhance D365 F&O functionalities when necessary.
- Support testing, troubleshooting, and user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure seamless deployments.
- Stay up to date with new D365 F&O features and evolving SCM trends to enhance solution offerings.
Required Skills & Experience:
- 5+ years of experience working with D365 F&O SCM, focusing on functional configuration, implementation, and support.
- Strong understanding of supply chain management principles, processes, and industry best practices.
- Hands-on experience with key D365 F&O SCM modules, including Inventory Management, Procurement & Sourcing, and Warehouse Management.
- Proven track record in leading client-facing projects and managing stakeholder relationships.
- Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess and optimize business processes.
- Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
- Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
- D365 F&O certifications (e.g., MB-330: Finance and Operations, Supply Chain Management).
- Experience integrating D365 F&O with other enterprise systems.
- Familiarity with Agile project methodologies.
This role presents a fantastic opportunity for a seasoned D365 F&O SCM professional to contribute to high-impact projects while working in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment.
If you're interested in learning more, please get in touch for further details.

title: FP&A Analyst w/ D365 BC and Power BI Exp. - NYC - $135k
description: Our client is seeking an experienced FP&A Analyst to join their growing team. In this role, you will be reporting to the VP Finance with responsibility for design, development and deployment of their financial systems and financial reporting, with a particular focus on Microsoft Dynamics Business Central 365, Power BI, and other related financial platforms, reports and analysis. You will partner with cross-functional teams and will interact with internal stakeholders to deliver project-specific deliverables aligned with pre-defined milestones and timelines, and with business unit heads to develop and implement key performance and financial reports using Power BI. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics, Power BI, accounting, reporting with demonstrable experience working with sophisticated ERP systems.

title: Responsable Comptable - ERP Business Central
description:
Nous recrutons aujourd'hui un(e) Responsable Comptable pour une entreprise en forte croissance, proposant des solutions innovantes dans un domaine d'actualité et d'avenir. Rattaché(e) à la direction financière, vous encadrerez un comptable senior et un alternant. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans la structuration de la comptabilité / trésorerie et assurez les missions suivantes :
Comptabilité générale et auxiliaire :
- Supervision des états financiers (mensuels, trimestriels, annuels).
- Garantie de la conformité aux normes comptables (French GAAP, IFRS).
- Encadrement des opérations courantes (fournisseurs, immobilisations, stocks, notes de frais).
- Suivi des clôtures et réconciliations comptables.
- Interface avec les commissaires aux comptes.
Trésorerie :
- Élaboration du plan de trésorerie prévisionnel.
- Suivi des règlements et du recouvrement.
- Gestion des relations bancaires et optimisation des flux.
- Reporting de trésorerie et suivi quotidien des positions.
Fiscalité :
- Pilotage des déclarations fiscales (TVA, IS, CVAE, etc.).
- Préparation des liasses fiscales.
- Veille réglementaire.
Contrôle interne et amélioration continue :
- Structuration des procédures comptables.
- Optimisation des processus (digitalisation, automatisation, ERP).
- Sécurisation des flux financiers.
Systèmes d'information et projets transverses :
- Administration de l'ERP (Microsoft Dynamics Business Central).
- Gestion des outils de notes de frais et cartes.
- Collaboration avec les équipes finance, juridique, RH, achats.
Il s'agit d'une belle opportunité sur un poste à responsabilités au sein d'une entreprise qui se développe à l'échelle nationale et internationale et qui accompagne ses collaborateurs dans leur montée en compétences dans une ambiance conviviale avec des évènements internes réguliers.
Vous bénéficiez d'une prise en charge des transports à 100%, de tickets restaurants de 10€ par jour et de la possibilité de faire 2 jours de télétravail par semaine.

benefits: ['Prise en charge des transports à 100%', 'Tickets restaurants de 10€ par jour', '2 jours de télétravail par semaine', 'Ambiance conviviale avec des évènements internes réguliers']

title: ERP-Spezialist Microsoft Dynamics NAV (m/w/d)
description: ERP-Spezialist Microsoft Dynamics NAV (m/w/d) Standort: Essen Eintritt: Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt. Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir einen engagierten ERP-Spezialisten (m/w/d) für Microsoft Dynamics NAV. Ihre Aufgaben: Annahme und Klassifizierung interner Kundenanfragen sowie Prüfung auf Leistungsabdeckung. Analyse von Problemstellungen, Identifikation von Anwenderfehlern und Fehlerbehebung inklusive Quellcodeanalyse. Beratung der Anwender zur korrekten Softwareanwendung. Fehlerbehebung unter Berücksichtigung projektspezifischer Anpassungen und Customizing. Durchführung von Schulungen für Anwender (Standardmodule und kundenspezifische Anpassungen). Fachliche Beratung bei der Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen. Ihr Profil: Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation. Fundierte Erfahrung im Support von Microsoft Dynamics NAV. Verständnis für betriebliche Abläufe, insbesondere in Einkauf und Produktion - idealerweise in der Lebensmittelindustrie. Selbstständige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit. Programmierkenntnisse in C/SIDE, C/AL, AL sowie idealerweise auch in C# / .Net und Visual Studio. Wir bieten: Unbefristete Vollzeitstelle (40-Stunden-Woche). Abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeiten mit Eigenverantwortung. Flache Hierarchien, kurze Entscheidungswege und ein kollegiales Arbeitsumfeld. Individuelle Entwicklungs- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten. Attraktive Vergütung. 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr. Ein sicherer Arbeitsplatz in einem erfolgreichen, wachsenden Familienunternehmen, das auf gegenseitigen Respekt und Vertrauen setzt.

title: Data Engineer
description: Join a rapidly growing Microsoft Partner Consultancy as a Data Engineer or Senior Data Engineer! This is your chance to join a rapidly growing Microsoft Partner who've developed a cutting-edge Microsoft Data Platform, helping their customers accelerate their data journeys. From better data management to smarter insights, you'll play a key role in enabling businesses to make truly data-driven decisions. Remote-first with flexibility: Work from anywhere in the UK, or from one of their regional offices if you prefer. Plus, enjoy bi-monthly company-wide events to connect, celebrate success, and collaborate with your team. What you'll do: You'll work end-to-end on enterprise-level data solutions—from data and systems integration, migrations (including CRM and ERP), and building robust data pipelines, to analytics and visualisation. Senior Engineers will also lead teams and drive best practices. Tech stack you'll work with: Python, SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake, Dynamics 365, Power BI, Microsoft Fabric.

title: System Engineer (Business Central & Connectwise)

Systems Engineer 1 & 3 - Tampa, Florida
A fast growing managed services provider of IT services based in Tampa (33609) is on the lookout for a Project Engineer 3 and Systems Engineer 1 & 3 who will be working directly with clients. This company provides great growth opportunities and is known to receive frequent recognition for its great culture and continuous growth.

Project Engineer 3 Job Responsibilities:
* Performs engineering design evaluations and works to complete projects within budget.
* Reviews industry policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy, security, and regulatory compliance.
* Provides technical support for all engineering processes.
* Takes action to resolve operational problems and minimise delays.
* Project Engineer 3 can work independently and consistently and follow Best Practices
* Engaging Project escalation team in timely manner.
* Documentation is essential to all projects as a key to our service delivery success.
* Collaboration with project team members regarding status, milestones, risks on all projects assigned is required and necessary in order to meet our KPI's (Key Performance Indicators).
* Project Engineer 3 has a technical core competency that can be demonstrated and is able to stay current in knowledge of hardware, software, networking, applications, and systems engineering.
* Company training is provided, both instructor-led and through online professional training tools provided by your supervisor.
* Project Engineer 3 can display leadership and encouragement through a positive, rewarding and fun environment.
* Project Engineer 3 can work closely in a team environment with account managers, project managers and vertical teams.

* Hardware - Support and troubleshooting including identifying, using and connecting hardware components and devices as well as setup and install common peripheral devices
* Windows Operating Systems - Install and support Windows OS including command line and client support
* Software Troubleshooting - Troubleshoot PC and mobile device issues
* Support of MS Office and Office 365 suite

* Security - Identify and protect against security vulnerabilities for devices and their network connections
* Mobile device support - Install and configure laptops and other mobile devices
* Support and provide basic understanding of Mac OS, Linux, and mobile OS
* Server and network maintenance for varied network environments
* Escalate to higher level support, as required
* After-hours Primary/Secondary support every few months
* Create/Update proper documentation, diagrams and other detailed instructions
* Experience with Dynamics Navision/Business Central and Connectwise is great to have!

title: Power BI Developer - Insurance
description: A specialist reinsurance broker are looking for a Power BI enthusiast to join their growing team in Central London - hybrid working, with 2-3 days per week in the office. The business is relatively "new" to the market, meaning they have no legacy systems, and they are incredibly digitally driven - they truly are a modern broker built for today's world, with incredibly forward-thinking working practices. Working within the Data team, you will lead on the end-to-end delivery of insightful Power BI reporting solutions for various stakeholders on a global scale. This will involve scoping and gathering requirements, developing the solution itself, and then delivering actionable business insights. So whilst this is a very technical role, it will also involve lots of stakeholder engagement, and would be well-suited to someone who enjoys working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You'll also get involved in Data Engineering projects - they're currently operating on an Azure Data Platform, with plans to move to a multi-cloud platform using Google Cloud later this year - offering the chance to broaden your skills with new and emerging technologies! This is a brilliant opportunity for a data professional to join a business who truly are at the leading-edge of their field, and who are committed to leveraging technology to fuel their growth.

title: D365 Solution Architect (Project Accounting)
description:
D365 F&O Solutions Architect - NYC / Remote - $200k
Our client is a global Microsoft Dynamics F&O end user in the professional services and engineering space that is looking for an in-house Solutions Architect to take ownership of their business applications and lead continuous improvement projects.
Feel like your job lacks career growth and purpose? This may be an excellent opportunity for you! As the company continues to grow, this position will become a key player in scaling their system to meet work flow demands, leveraging the ERP and Business Intelligence tools for improved strategic decision making. For now, we need someone with a customer-centric mindset capable of optimizing user self-sufficiency and who is capable of problem solving support tickets and identifying paths for improvement strategically.
We are also looking for a candidate with extensive knowledge of the project accounting module in D365 F&O as well as experience with CE integrations and Power Platform optimization.

title: Database Administrator - D365 Business Central - $100k Miami
description:
Database Admin - Dynamics 365 Business Central - Miami - $100k
Our client is a well-established, publicly traded equipment parts distributor who is putting a heavy investment in their technology operations and building out an internal team to support several newly implemented systems.
We are seeking a highly skilled and performance-focused Database Administrator (DBA) with deep expertise in designing, building, and maintaining scalable, high-performance data warehouses. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience integrating data across Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, Salesforce CRM, and ADP Payroll, and will play a critical role in our organization's journey toward a data-driven future.

(Preferred)', 'Knowledge of Power BI, Tableau, or similar BI tools. (Preferred)', 'Microsoft Azure certifications (Data Engineer, Solutions Architect, etc.) (Preferred)']

title: D365 Enterprise Architect
description: Join a high-impact team where your technical expertise will shape scalable enterprise solutions. We are seeking a Dynamics 365 CE + F&O Enterprise Architect with a strong background in Azure integrations and plugin development. This hybrid role offers the flexibility to work from home, with three days onsite per week in NYC, Chicago, Atlanta, or Charlotte. We are open to candidates from both consulting and end-user environments, as long as you're prepared for a fast-paced, high-pressure delivery setting. While this is an IC role, there may be management opportunities in the future. If you're ready to drive digital transformation through innovative architecture, apply now and make an impact with a global industry leader. Core benefits include medical and dental coverage. Immediate start available! W2 direct hire only. No C2C or third-party candidates can be considered.

title: D365 Service Delivery Manager - North East - cGBP90K

Nigel Frank are working with a global organisation on their search for a Service Delivery Manager with experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and F&O. Our client has a strong presence across 28 countries and an ambitious digital transformation agenda - this is a rare opportunity to influence the success of a global D365 landscape. This role is suited to a proactive and technically capable professional who thrives in a service-led environment and is passionate about continual improvement. You'll be instrumental in managing the delivery, support, and governance of D365 services across a global footprint and you will ensure smooth transitions from project delivery to business-as-usual operations while leading efforts to maintain and enhance system performance, user satisfaction, and service efficiency. This is a hands-on role requiring both technical and service delivery expertise, combined with the ability to manage cross-functional collaboration and stakeholder engagement.

title: D365 BC Solutions Manager
description:
D365 Business Central Solutions Manager - Baltimore/Remote - $150k
Are you a hands-on ERP Project Manager looking to join a company with a great culture? This is the opportunity for you. Our client, a publishing industry Dynamics 365 Business Central end user, is looking for a Business Solutions Manager to lead a series of ongoing integration, improvement, and upgrade projects on a constantly evolving system. We are looking for someone who is up to date on the latest and greatest in Microsoft Dynamics, Azure, and the Power Platform; an Agile Delivery Lead who can both manage teams and step in where need be on configuration and support efforts.

Your New Company:
- Leading scientific and medical search publishing organization with a national presence
- A mission-drive, employee centric organization with a fun company culture and excellent work/life balance
- A well-established organization who is putting a heavy investment in their technology infrastructure, focused on continuous improvement
- A community focused organization who believes in giving back as one of their highest priorities

Your New Role:
- Lead ERP strategy, upgrades, and cloud migrations
- Drive Agile delivery across sprints and roadmaps
- Collaborate with stakeholders and tech teams
- Manage integrations, technical debt, and innovation
- Present insights to execs and guide transformation
- Oversee a technical team, working closely with stakeholders on systems and process improvements

What You'll Need:
- 5+ years of experience in managing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central solutions, including at least 2 Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central upgrade and implementations completed
- Expert finance and accounting process knowledge
- Experience with supply chain and EDI integrations preferred, not required
- PMP or Scrum Master certification a big plus
- Expertise in Microsoft Azure, including cloud infrastructure, security, and integrations.
- Strong proficiency in Microsoft Power Platform, especially Microsoft Power Apps for low-code application development.
- 5+ years in a team leadership capacity

What You'll Receive:
- Competitive base salary ($135-150k range)
- Remote flexibility with limited travel (note: certain state restrictions are in place)
- Excellent benefits and PTO plan
- Amazing work/life balance (less than 40 hours most weeks)
- Career growth potential with the opportunity to work on an exciting project pipeline

Want to learn more? Apply now by sending your CV to m.potenza@nigelfrank.com or call Matt at 646-540-7521 for more details.

title: D365 Business Central Consultant (SCM focus)
description:
D365 Business Central - SCM Consultant
Location: Stockholm / Hybrid
Employer: Leading Microsoft Partner
Are you an experienced Dynamics 365 Business Central (D365 BC) professional with a passion for Supply Chain Management (SCM)? Would you like to join a forward-thinking Microsoft Partner that values innovation, flexibility, and collaboration?
We're supporting a top-tier Microsoft Dynamics Partner in Malmö that is expanding its consulting team. They're now looking to bring on board an experienced D365 Business Central Consultant with a strong background in Supply Chain processes to support their growing pipeline of local and international projects.
As a key part of the consulting team, you will:
- Lead and deliver full life cycle D365 Business Central implementations, with a focus on SCM (purchasing, inventory, warehousing, logistics).
- Collaborate with project managers, developers, and fellow consultants in a dynamic partner environment.
- Work closely with end clients to understand business needs, gather requirements, and translate them into scalable BC solutions.
- Take ownership of the supply chain workstreams, ensuring successful delivery from design to go-live.
- Contribute to both new implementations and upgrades from NAV to D365 BC.
What We're Looking For:
- 3+ years' experience with Dynamics NAV / D365 Business Central, ideally across multiple versions (NAV 2009 through to BC SaaS).
- Proven track record in Supply Chain Management modules (e.g., procurement, inventory, order management, warehouse).
- Solid functional consulting skills - comfortable running workshops, gathering requirements, configuring systems, and training users.
- Experience in a Microsoft Partner or customer-facing consulting environment is highly desirable.
- Strong communication skills in English - Swedish is a plus.
Why Apply?
- Be part of a highly respected Microsoft Gold Partner with a growing footprint in Sweden.
- Work on exciting SCM transformation projects with established clients.
- Enjoy a hybrid working model, flexible hours, and a supportive team culture.
- Competitive compensation, great benefits, and strong career development opportunities.

title: Business Analytics Manager
description: My client, a multinational company with HQ in Europe and business across the globe, is now looking for a Business Analytics Manager to join their internal data team. Key Responsibilities: Lead the design, development, and maintenance of business intelligence dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to support strategic initiatives. Oversee data collection, integration, and analysis from multiple structured and unstructured sources to deliver accurate and meaningful insights. Manage end-to-end analytics projects, from requirements gathering and data preparation to presentation and recommendation delivery. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and propose data-driven solutions using advanced analytics and storytelling techniques. Establish standards for documentation, visualization design, and reporting methodologies to ensure consistency and quality. Drive automation of recurring reporting processes through tools such as Power BI, Python, SQL, VBA, RPA, and O365 applications. Support executive and departmental decision-making by delivering timely insights and performance metrics. Mentor, guide, and develop junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation. Ensure data governance, data quality, and metadata management best practices are followed across analytics initiatives.
